posts.post_content: To repeat myself, I believe fast milling should be red. Blue should concentrate on specific card [Extract](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Extract)ion and protection against mill effects by using buyback, counterspells and effects that can be played if put into graveyard from your library. Red could also use the effect in a multiplayer mode, stating "each player" instead. This could support flashback, dredge, unearth, threshold as well.
posts.html:

Red could also use the effect in a multiplayer mode, stating "each player" instead. This could support flashback, dredge, unearth, threshold as well.

posts.post_content: Hey Cheza, I think your just tired of losing to Mill decks. I don't think Red would be a good color for fast milling because Red is all about fast damage. Blue and Black are great for milling because both those colors deal with removing memories and such (I'm talking about the flavour) I do dislike decks that run 4 of every mill card made though. I feel milling should be a mixture of presision and subtlety, with decks that use cards like [Wrexial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrexial) to win, not just relying on decking the oppoment.
posts.html:
Hey Cheza, I think your just tired of losing to Mill decks. I don't think Red would be a good color for fast milling because Red is all about fast damage. Blue and Black are great for milling because both those colors deal with removing memories and such (I'm talking about the flavour) I do dislike decks that run 4 of every mill card made though.
